result.execSummary:
The defendant Thaddeus J Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions: Engage in all programming suggested by agent; attend, pay for, and successfully complete any classes ordered by agent; pay costs of action (1 set of costs). Expungement per 973.015 upon successful completion of probation. Defendant will need to follow up with Clerk of Court regarding the expungement procedure when the time comes.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thaddeus J Hanson in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Mcdougal states the def will plead to both counts and both parties jointly recommend to withold sentence, 2 years probation with expungment if def succesfully completes probation: Count 1-Imposed and stayed, 9 months. Count 2-Imposed and stayed, 30 days, concurrent with count 1. Def pleads NC to both counts. Court's colloquy on pleas. Findings of guilty. No comment by the State. Atty McDougal addresses the court, asks the court to adopt the joint recommendation. Def addresses the court. 

Court orders:
Count 1: 9 months in county jail,imposed and stayed. Be placed on two years probation. 
Count 2: 30 days in county jail,imposed and stayed, concurrent with count 1. 
Probation conditions: Be engaged in all programming suggested by agent, attend, pay for, successfully complete any classes ordered by agent; pay costs of actions, one set of court costs; expungement per 973.015 upon successful completion of probation. 2 days credit.

RCSD - Disposition of Warrant or Commitment (In custody)
Adjourned initial appearance on March 15, 2017 at 11:00 am.

1:35 p.m.  Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Thaddeus J Hanson. Defendant Thaddeus J Hanson appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail where he is in custody following warrant pickup.  Atty. M states that she was appointed today by SPD office.  DA Harper asks that prior bail be reinstated.  Court admonishes def re missing court.  Bond reinstated and next date/time set for 3/15 at 11.  Def has verified phone addess and phone number; phone is cell.  Clerk notes that def will receive notice via text of the next court date.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 15, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Adjourned initial appearance on December 14, 2016 at 09:00 am. (emailed to the jail to print and give to def prior to his release)
Def from the Richland County Jail

1:46 p.m. Defendant Thaddeus J Hanson appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail following FTA warrant pick-up. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court notes def failed to appear on Nov. 2nd. Forehand notes that def received notice of the 11/2 date on the bond he signed. Def has noted a different address; notes it on the record. Def states he didn't know he had court on 11/2. Forehand and Court emphasize importance of keeping dates straight. Previous signature bond reinstated. Def is employed. Court advises def of his rights to counsel and instructs him to contact counsel between now and next date 12/14 at 9; start with SPD for eligibility determination.  Clerk requests def to submit change of address.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

4:00 p.m.  Defendant Thaddeus J Hanson not in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA requests warrant. Def's bond stated he was due in court at 3:30.  Warrant so ordered.
